title.narrative: Strategic plan for Coffee value chain.

description.narrative:
UGEAFI s three-year strategic plan 2008-2011 Tupiganishe Umaskini is a logical follow-up of the previous one that ended in June 2008.
During December 2007 and January 2008 Oxfam Novib commissioned an impact assessment of the Aim 1 programs of its counterparts in Eastern DRC. UGEAFI participated in this, but only for the activities in the Moyen Plateau, where the main focus is on coffee production and agriculture. UGEAFI has incorporated the recommendations of the impact assessment, and the results of the previous program.
The current program has as its main axes: peace and reconciliation, education, food and income security (crop and cattle farmingand coffee production, processing and marketing), and gender. The intervention area is territory of Fizi in South Kivu in the Democratic Republic Congo, notable the Moyen Plateau of Mutambala and Bibokoboko, and the Haute Plateau of Minembwe.
This project aims to improve socio-economic conditions of populations due i) to reinforcement and consolidation of access to those populations to education (information and knowledge), ii) to agricultural income and iii) better implication of state in development of these two sectors. This project is based in Haut and Moyen Plateaux in territories of Fizi and Uvira. This project of a duration of one 18 months (from January 2013 to June 2014) was implemented by UGEAFI and financed by Oxfam Novib. Expected results: - Reinforcement of farmer#s capacities in various techniques related to production, sanitary treatment andmarketing of coffee. - One wash station for coffee is put in place and managed by ten cooperatives under responsibility of Furaha Coffee. This station increases quality of coffee and makes it more competitive on regional and international markets. - At the end of this project in 2014, income of coffee producers increase up to 60% - Famers cooperatives of coffee have knowledge on coffee value chain process, management of project cycle, financial and operational management and on fundraising. - The quality of coffee is improved due to small wash station. - 60,000 kg of double certified coffee are collectively passed by the 12 operational cooperatives supervised by UGEAFI and FURAHA COFFEE COOPERATIVES, which offers a good income opportunities for smallholder Addidtional information : this partnership of 18 years is submitted to internal policy of ONL, UGEAFI is today in phase out. This project will end on June 2014. It is thus important to specify that coffee is astrategic sector in ONL strategic plan.That is the reason for ONL and UGEAFI to search for further external financial resources to continue this project.

participating-org.narrative: UGEAFI (Union of Crop and Cattle Farmers of Fizi-Itobe) was founded in 1990, as a forum for local initiatives. UGEAFI brings together local organisations to develop initiatives for the region. Its objectives are to improve the living conditions of the people of the Haute Plateau of Minembwe and the Moyen Plateau of Mutambala and Bibokoboko, territory of Fizi, South Kivu, and to contribute to a sustainable peace whereby the different ethnic groups in the region coexist peacefully, to the development of sustainable agriculture and cattle farming, to improve the quality of and access to education and to improve the rights and position of women in society, especially by reinforcing the participation of girls and women in education and by strengthening their rights (e.g. inheritance rights). Initially UGEAFI worked with local grassroots organisations in the Haute Plateau. After an evaluation of its programs in 2005, UGEAFI revised its strategy and focuses on pilots: exemplary crop and cattle farmers, who stand out by their initiative and input.They serve as models and are supported to work on new methods and crops. They in their turn work to introduce this to the other members of the communities. From 2005 on at the request of the farmers in Mutambala and Bibokoboko, UGEAFI started to support coffee producers in the Moyen Plateau of Mutambala and Bibokoboko, which has resulted in an enormous revitalisation of coffee production. Most coffee producers are organised in co-operatives. In the 2009-2010 program UGEAFI will support the producers in the processing of coffee and in bringing it to the market. UGEAFI works mainly in Lemera, Mutambala, Bibokoboko and Itombwe, in territoires of Uvira and Fizi, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo. This partner has achieved, thought long partnership with Oxfam Novib, strong capacities of mobilization of funds and communication. It is financed by various external donors, as Oxfam Germany.
